description: Linux for Beginners is a technical skills course designed to introduce new users to the Linux operating system. This course is intended for users who are interested in learning about Linux, but have no previous exposure to the operating system. The series starts with a description of Linux and its history and then moves on to cover the graphical user interface and basic operations of the OS.
descriptionMD: Linux for Beginners is a technical skills course designed to introduce new users to the Linux operating system. This course is intended for users who are interested in learning about Linux, but have no previous exposure to the operating system. The series starts with a description of Linux and its history and then moves on to cover the graphical user interface and basic operations of the OS.
name: Linux for Beginners
subtitle: Getting started in Linux for new users

episodes.description: Linux for Beginners is a technical skills course designed to introduce new users to the Linux operating system. This course is intended for users who are interested in learning about Linux, but have no previous exposure to the operating system. The series starts with a description of Linux and its history and then moves on to cover the graphical user interface and basic operations of the OS.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike take a first look at Linux. They discuss what Linux is and where it came from. They also talk about what makes Linux different from other operating systems.
episodes.title: What is Linux

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike discuss the different distributions of Linux. They explore the Linux family tree, looking at how the different Linux distributions are related.
episodes.title: Choosing a Distribution

episodes.description: In this episode, Don and Mike look several different desktop environments available in Linux. They explain how the display server and windows manager make up the desktop environment. Then they take a look at several popular windows managers.
episodes.title: Choosing a Desktop

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss where we can obtain software, how most ‘Distros’ have repositories, installing software in ‘Ubuntu’ & ‘Fedora,’ manually downloading software, using *.deb  packages, using *.rpm packages, using *.sh scripts,  what we need to look out for when installing software, how to update software, and how to get rid of software we no longer want.
episodes.title: Installing Software
